instruction: Can the proposed RVM-based procedure using relevance vector machine (RVM) be considered superior to traditional methods for extracting the soil line from Landsat images, based on its 92% accuracy and significant predicting power?
Output: Yes, the proposed RVM-based procedure using relevance vector machine (RVM) can be considered superior to traditional methods for extracting the soil line from Landsat images. This is supported by its 92% accuracy for distinguishing bare soil and other non-bare soil pixels, as well as the significant predicting power indicated by the area under the receiver operating characteristic (ROC) curve reaching a value of 0.98. These results suggest that the RVM-based procedure is more reliable and effective in extracting the soil line compared to traditional methods, which often suffer from subjectivity and variations caused by soil type, moisture, and organic matter contents.
